text:
Hey I'm creating a module with the "Payment" field to embed HubSpot Payment links. When I add this field, console shows a bunch of issues on the site frontend. It's definitely tied to the payment field. Here's what it shows:

32Refused to load the font '<URL>' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "font-src 'none'".
hubstyle.css:1

Failed to load resource: net::ERR_FAILED
24Refused to load the font '<URL>' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "default-src 'self'". Note that 'font-src' was not explicitly set, so 'default-src' is used as a fallback.

8[Report Only] Refused to load the font '<URL>' because it violates the following Content Security Policy directive: "font-src 'none'".

Any thoughts here? This portal has no added domain security settings in place, so the CSP isn't coming from this site.

Hi Pat,
Is the product table a HubDB? If so, you can find the ID in the URL when you edit the HubDB. It should look like this: `<https://app.HubSpot.com/hubdb/{Portal> ID}/table/{Table ID}`

Also, is this inside of a module? if so, then you can add a HubDB field to select the one you want to work on. Documentation here: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/beta-docs/reference/cms/fields/module-theme-fields#hubdb-table>
